column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
This unassuming townsviis seems to recognize you from somewhere.
Speak with the unassuming townsviis.
Follow the unassuming townsviis.
You...it cannot be... Are you...!?
Ah...oh, no. My apologies for the outburst. I confused you for someone I once knew. Something about you...seems so familiar.
Perhaps you are a traveler as well? All who embark upon that path have a singular way about them. You must know much of the world outside the wood. Please, could you humor me with a story or two?
Haha, a wise choice. You knew I would not stop at asking for two. Well, if ever you find yourself idle and eager to entertain, I shall be here.
You agree!? Oh, many thanks to you. I am so starved for amusement these days.
I heard tell that Lakeland had been abandoned. I once heard the name of the elves' new home in passing, but for the life of me I cannot recall it.
What will you say?
You speak of the Crystarium.
Are you thinking of Eulmore?
Yes, yes, the Crystarium. They say that the Crystal Exarch conjured the spire in an instant. Oh, to wield such power...
Eulmore? Are you certain? No...the name had a different ring to it. It was almost...vibrant.
What of Nabaath Areng? That city produced such lustering trinkets! Does it still stand?
What will you say?
Only ruins remain.
It was consumed in the Flood.
How dreadful! Truly, the Flood spared no land...
Of course... The Flood brought ruin to even the grandest of cities...
Tell me, have you heard of the Warriors of Light? Grand heroes, saviors of worlds, and so on.
What will you say?
Not saviors. Destroyers.
Yes. They are heroes for us all.
Of course. I am a Warrior of Light.
Is that so? I suppose you are right, given the state of things here.
Indeed they are. I am glad to know there are some in this world who still believe in heroism.
Hah, of course you are! I am full glad there are still those who admire their bravery. It warms my heart to see.
I must thank you again for providing this old woman with company. Please, would you walk with me?

Since you have been so kind, I would tell you a story of my own in return. However, it would not do if I were to be overheard. There is a place where we may speak in private, to the west. It will not take long.
Thank you for coming. You may wonder why I brought you here.

You see, long ago in these very woods, I was wounded, and nursed back to health by travelers much like yourself. They were hunting a very specific prey, and in exchange for my help they shared stories of the outside world.
I remember very fondly that night, huddled by the fire, regaled by their wondrous tales. Although our time together was short, I know for certain there was naught but good in their hearts.
When I heard that those selfsame travelers brought about the Flood, I refused to believe it.
However, even if it is true, even if they caused this world's ruin... I cannot blame them. If they did somehow have a hand in it...it was not a willing one.
You know as well as I, but we Viis can live well over two centuries. I myself have seen my hundredth nameday come and go.
If the heavens deem it fit, we can live well over two centuries. I myself have seen my hundredth nameday come and go.
Even so, too many of us have met premature ends at the hands of the sin eaters. There are not many left who remember the time before the Flood.
That is why I was compelled to tell you of those travelers, so you might leave here with full knowledge of their character. Thank you for lending an ear to my story.
